goal:
EGEC, the European Geothermal Energy Council, was founded in 1998 as an international non-profit association in Brussels.
EGEC has now more than 120 members from 22 European countries: private companies, national associations, consultants, research centers, geological surveys and other public authoritiesâ€¦
EGEC is a member of the International Geothermal Association (IGA).

The aims of our organization are to promote the use of geothermal energy.
interests: Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade
